watcher.doc:
Watch for display and system sleep/wake/power events
and for fast user switching session events.

This module is based primarily on code from the previous incarnation of Mjolnir by [Steven Degutis](https://github.com/sdegutis/).

currentAssertions.desc: Fetches information about processes which are currently asserting display/power sleep restrictions
currentAssertions.doc:
Fetches information about processes which are currently asserting display/power sleep restrictions

Parameters:
 * None

Returns:
 * A table containing information about current power assertions, with process IDs (PID) as the keys, each of which may contain multiple assertions
currentAssertions.name: currentAssertions
returns: * A table containing information about current power assertions, with process IDs (PID) as the keys, each of which may contain multiple assertions

declareUserActivity.desc: Informs the OS that the user performed some activity
declareUserActivity.doc:
Informs the OS that the user performed some activity

Parameters:
 * id - An option number containing the assertion ID returned by a previous call of this function

Returns:
 * A number containing the ID of the assertion generated by this function

Notes:
 * This is intended to simulate user activity, for example to prevent displays from sleeping, or to wake them up
 * It is not mandatory to re-use assertion IDs if you are calling this function mulitple times, but it is recommended that you do so if the calls are related
declareUserActivity.name: declareUserActivity
notes: * This is intended to simulate user activity, for example to prevent displays from sleeping, or to wake them up
* It is not mandatory to re-use assertion IDs if you are calling this function mulitple times, but it is recommended that you do so if the calls are related
parameters: * id - An option number containing the assertion ID returned by a previous call of this function
returns: * A number containing the ID of the assertion generated by this function

fastUserSwitch.desc: Show the Fast User Switch screen (ie a login screen without logging out first)
fastUserSwitch.doc:
Show the Fast User Switch screen (ie a login screen without logging out first)

Parameters:
 * None

Returns:
 * None
fastUserSwitch.name: fastUserSwitch

get.desc: Queries whether a particular sleep type is being prevented
get.doc:
Queries whether a particular sleep type is being prevented

Parameters:
 * sleepType - A string containing the type of sleep to inspect (see [hs.caffeinate.set()](#set) for information about the possible values)

Returns:
 * True if the specified type of sleep is being prevented, false if not. nil if sleepType was an invalid value
get.name: get
parameters: * sleepType - A string containing the type of sleep to inspect (see [hs.caffeinate.set()](#set) for information about the possible values)
returns: * True if the specified type of sleep is being prevented, false if not. nil if sleepType was an invalid value

lockScreen.doc:
Locks the displays

Parameters:
 * None

Returns:
 * None

Notes:
 * This function uses private Apple APIs and could therefore stop working in any given release of macOS without warning.
lockScreen.name: lockScreen
notes: * This function uses private Apple APIs and could therefore stop working in any given release of macOS without warning.

logOut.desc: Request the system log out the current user
logOut.doc:
Request the system log out the current user

Parameters:
 * None

Returns:
 * None
logOut.name: logOut

restartSystem.doc:
Request the system reboot

Parameters:
 * None

Returns:
 * None
restartSystem.name: restartSystem

sessionProperties.desc: Fetches information from the display server about the current session
sessionProperties.doc:
Fetches information from the display server about the current session

Parameters:
 * None

Returns:
 * A table containing information about the current session, or nil if an error occurred

Notes:
 * The keys in this dictionary will vary based on the current state of the system (e.g. local vs VNC login, screen locked vs unlocked).
sessionProperties.name: sessionProperties
notes: * The keys in this dictionary will vary based on the current state of the system (e.g. local vs VNC login, screen locked vs unlocked).
returns: * A table containing information about the current session, or nil if an error occurred

set.doc:
Configures the sleep prevention settings

Parameters:
 * sleepType - A string containing the type of sleep to be configured. The value should be one of:
  * displayIdle - Controls whether the screen will be allowed to sleep (and also the system) if the user is idle.
  * systemIdle - Controls whether the system will be allowed to sleep if the user is idle (display may still sleep).
  * system - Controls whether the system will be allowed to sleep for any reason.
 * aValue - A boolean, true if the specified type of sleep should be prevented, false if it should be allowed
 * acAndBattery - A boolean, true if the sleep prevention should apply to both AC power and battery power, false if it should only apply to AC power.

Returns:
 * None

Notes:
 * These calls are not guaranteed to prevent the system sleep behaviours described above. The OS may override them if it feels it must (e.g. if your CPU temperature becomes dangerously high).
 * The acAndBattery argument only applies to the `system` sleep type.
 * You can toggle the acAndBattery state by calling `hs.caffeinate.set()` again and altering the acAndBattery value.
 * The acAndBattery option does not appear to work anymore - it is based on private API that is not allowed in macOS 10.15 when running with the Hardened Runtime (which Hammerspoon now uses).
set.name: set
notes: * These calls are not guaranteed to prevent the system sleep behaviours described above. The OS may override them if it feels it must (e.g. if your CPU temperature becomes dangerously high).
* The acAndBattery argument only applies to the `system` sleep type.
* You can toggle the acAndBattery state by calling `hs.caffeinate.set()` again and altering the acAndBattery value.
* The acAndBattery option does not appear to work anymore - it is based on private API that is not allowed in macOS 10.15 when running with the Hardened Runtime (which Hammerspoon now uses).
parameters:
* sleepType - A string containing the type of sleep to be configured. The value should be one of:
   * displayIdle - Controls whether the screen will be allowed to sleep (and also the system) if the user is idle.
   * systemIdle - Controls whether the system will be allowed to sleep if the user is idle (display may still sleep).
   * system - Controls whether the system will be allowed to sleep for any reason.
* aValue - A boolean, true if the specified type of sleep should be prevented, false if it should be allowed
* acAndBattery - A boolean, true if the sleep prevention should apply to both AC power and battery power, false if it should only apply to AC power.

shutdownSystem.desc: Request the system log out and power down
shutdownSystem.doc:
Request the system log out and power down

Parameters:
 * None

Returns:
 * None
shutdownSystem.name: shutdownSystem

startScreensaver.desc: Request the system start the screensaver (which may lock the screen if the OS is configured to do so)
startScreensaver.doc:
Request the system start the screensaver (which may lock the screen if the OS is configured to do so)

Parameters:
 * None

Returns:
 * None
startScreensaver.name: startScreensaver

systemSleep.desc: Requests the system to sleep immediately
systemSleep.doc:
Requests the system to sleep immediately

Parameters:
 * None

Returns:
 * None
systemSleep.name: systemSleep

toggle.desc: Toggles the current state of the specified type of sleep
toggle.doc:
Toggles the current state of the specified type of sleep

Parameters:
 * sleepType - A string containing the type of sleep to toggle (see [hs.caffeinate.set()](#set) for information about the possible values)

Returns:
 * True if the specified type of sleep is being prevented, false if not. nil if sleepType was an invalid value

Notes:
 * If systemIdle is toggled to on, it will apply to AC only
toggle.name: toggle
notes: * If systemIdle is toggled to on, it will apply to AC only
parameters: * sleepType - A string containing the type of sleep to toggle (see [hs.caffeinate.set()](#set) for information about the possible values)
returns: * True if the specified type of sleep is being prevented, false if not. nil if sleepType was an invalid value
